reviews.review_msg: The lecture notes were of little help with the exams compared to the sample exams. A large number of students could not even submit a solution for the assignment because he refused to extend deadlines and he only provided cryptic, general support.

I'm a good student (4.0 GPA), but this guy was something else. Tests were heavy on critical-thinking, but the notes didn't prepare for that at all. Assignments had inconsistent difficulties (unlike what he promised). On many occasions, I was on the verge of a nervous breakdown because of his apathetic attitude to students. Take at your own risk.

Brian's a good guy and it's clear he wants his students to succeed. His assignments are brutal though. Lectures are focused just on theory so you are expected to learn a lot of C on your own. I imagine the course being much easier with Pearce but if you want to actually learn I strongly recommend taking it with Brian.

Brian is a great lecturer and EXTREMELY helpful in office hours, especially email. Kudos, very refreshing! That being said, his assignments were brutal and extremely time consuming. Be prepared to WORK A LOT. Exams were tough, you really need to know the material well. Blind memorization will get you nowhere.  Take it if you want a challenge.
